text: was a Japanese daimyō of the Sengoku period, who was a traditional authority in the north half of Dewa Province and the south half of Yezo island. Kiyosue was the son of Andō Hirosue. Kiyosue mediated the Ainu dispute with the Japanese who followed for about 100 years, and had their trade agreements concluded.Mineo Kaiho, エゾの歴史, Tokyo:Kodansha, 1996, ==References== Category:1514 births Category:1553 deaths Category:Andō clan Category:Daimyo Category:People from Akita Prefecture
title: Andō Kiyosue
